{{NCAATeamFootballSeason |Year=1993 |Team=Wyoming Cowboys |Image= |ImageSize = |Conference=Western Athletic Conference |Division= |ShortConference=WAC |Record=8â4 |ConfRecord= |CoachRank= |APRank= |HeadCoach=[[Joe Tiller]] |OffCoach= |DefCoach= |OScheme= |DScheme= |Stadium=[[War Memorial Stadium (Wyoming)|War Memorial Stadium]] |Champion=WAC Co-Champions |BowlTourney=[[1993 Copper Bowl]] |BowlTourneyResult= Loss, 17â52, [[1993 Kansas State Wildcats football team|Kansas State]] }} {{1993 WAC football standings}} The Wyoming Cowboys represented the [[University of Wyoming]] in the 1993 NCAA Football season. The Cowboys finished the season 8â4 and 6â2 in conference play to share the [[Western Athletic Conference]] championship with Brigham Young and Fresno State. The Cowboys offense scored 357 points, while the defense allowed 329 points. At seasonâs end, the Cowboys were not ranked in the National Rankings.
